DOC.brief_title: Cognitive Behavioral Group Therapy Trichotillomania ( Hair Pulling Disorder )
DOC.detailed_description: The Norwegian Trichotillomania Project multicenter study aim evaluate effectiveness behavioral group therapy TTM , i.e. , ACT ( Acceptance commitment therapy ) enhance habit reversal training ( ACT-enhanced HRT ) . Participants adults adolescent ( 16 year older ) fulfill criterion TTM accord DSM-IV . Inclusion start January 2013 complete Mai 2016 . Treatment deliver three treatment sit Norway ; Kristiansand , Oslo , Trondheim . Treatment manualized , follow manual Twohig Woods , consist ten group session three hour deliver consecutive week , two three booster session first year treatment . Treatment outcome evaluate three outcome measure ; Massachusetts General Hospital - Hairpulling Scale ( self-report ) ; National Institute Mental Health Trichotillomania Severity Scale ( clinical interview , conduct independent evaluator ) ; Clinical Global Impression Scale TTM . Outcome measure three point time ; baseline , end treatment , one-year follow-up . Mixed model procedure SPSS use analyze longitudinal data . The first paper write patient admit treatment January 2013 September 2014 , include 53 patient ( 49 woman four men ) . By January 2016 , fifty-one patient ( 96 % ) participate one-year follow-up evaluation .
